thread.title: Syrian President Bashar Assad open to run in election
thread.title_full: Syrian President Bashar Assad open to run in election - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Syrian President Bashar Assad open to run in election
text:
Anadolu Agency/Getty Images Syrian President Bashar Assad (c.) meets with Russian President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin Palace in Moscow on Wednesday. DAMASCUS — Syrian President Bashar Assad is willing to run in an early presidential election, hold parliamentary elections and discuss constitutional changes, but only after the defeat of “terrorist” groups, Russian lawmakers said after meeting with the Syrian leader on Sunday.
The meeting came as Russia, the U.S., Saudi Arabia and Turkey were discussing new ideas for a political transition in Syria to end the nearly five-year war, which has killed 250,000 people and displaced half the country’s population.
The Western-backed Syrian opposition and other insurgent groups have refused to back any plan that does not include Assad’s exit from power.
The Syrian government views the entire armed opposition as “terrorists” and has been waging an offensive on several fronts in recent weeks backed by Russian air strikes.
Related Stories Syrian President Assad meets Russian leader Putin in Moscow Hero Joshua Wheeler, first U.S soldier to die in ISIS raid UN says it mistakenly sent expired biscuits to Syrians
